document.masterDocTitle: Miscophus Jurine, 1807 (Hymenoptera, Crabronidae) in Central, Northern, and Eastern Europe

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Miscophus Jurine, 1807 (Hymenoptera, Crabronidae) in Central, Northern, and Eastern Europe

subSubSection.paragraph:
Miscophus albufeirae Andrade, 1952:20
, female. Holotype : female, Portugal : Albufeira Lagoon ( holotype Coimbra , probably lost. A female paratype from MZL examined by CSE).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Miscophus susterai
Balthasar, 1953 :43
, female. Holotype : female, Cyprus : Yermasoyia River (NMPC). Examined by CSE, syn. nov.

Miscophus unigena
Balthasar, 1953 :50
, female. Holotype : female, Cyprus : Yermasoyia River (NMPC). Examined by CSE, syn. nov.

Miscophus albufeirae anatolicus de
Beaumont, 1967 :335
, female.
Holotype : female, Turkey : Mersin : Mut (Schwarz)
. Paratype examined by CSE, syn. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph: Geographic distribution. Cyprus , France , Greece , Hungary , Kyrgyzstan , Portugal , Russia , Spain , Turkey .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Comment .
Miscophus albufeirae
is widely distributed, but occurring locally, and is very rare. It seems to occur in salinated biotopes and their surroundings. We were able to examine specimens from all the countries listed above except Portugal . Populations from Turkey described as
ssp. anatolicus
by de Beaumont (1967) as well as type specimens of
Miscophus unigena
and
M. susterai
described by Balthasar (1953) from Cyprus , are junior synonyms of
Miscophus albufeirae
described from Portugal . The males described by Andrade (1960) from western France and tentatively treated by him as the unknown male of
M. albufeirae
, in our opinion are
M. albufeirae
as well because of the particular form of the medial lamella of ACM (see fig. 123/p 51 in Andrade 1960 ). Medial lamella of ACM is larger and less protruded as in related species and represents a unique male character of
M. albufeirae
. We disagree with the interpretation of Mokrousov (2004) who considers these males to be
M. johni
, because of the narrower and more protruded medial lamella of ACM of
M. johni
(see fig. 1-1/p. 376 in Mokrousov 2004 ).
